attributes.action: more mony to those on dole who peveiously payed tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I would like to start my petition of with the fact that nearly everyone is faced with the risk of redundancy, whether it’s your company going bankrupt, or simply your boss laying of a few wages. My father’s work colleague had been made redundant, around a fortnight ago. He has been working for 25 years, and payed hundreds of thousands of pounds in tax. He has only received £60 on dole, when someone else who has not worked at all, would receive the same amount. He is receiving the same rewards of someone who’s exactly the same as him, but has done no work. I say NO. If you have been made redundant, after years of work, you should get greater benefits. For instance for every £10,000 you pay in tax money you receive an extra £1 on dole. Matthew Haythornthwaite 14.
